OAuth2.description:
Elorus supports OAuth2 for third-party applications that want to securely
access user data. To begin, you should contact us to 
register your application and obtain a `client_id` and a `client_secret`. 

Elorus currently only supports the Oauth2 *password* flow. To actually 
get a user *access token* you must send a `POST` request to the 
`https://api.elorus.com/oauth2/token/` endpoint. 
Your `client_id` and `client_secret` must be sent using the standard 
Basic Authentication scheme. In the request body, you must include the 
`grant_type`, `username` and `password` parameters:

* `grant_type`: Must always be set to `password`
* `username`: The email address or username of the user that your application 
wants to access.
* `password`: The password of the user that your application 
wants to access.

Example using `curl`:

    curl https://api.elorus.com/oauth/token/  \
    -X POST \
    -H 'Accept:application/json' \
    -u client_id:client_secret \
    -d '{ \
    "grant_type": "password", \
    "username": "user@example.com", \
    "password": "the_password" \
    }'

On success, you will get a response that looks like this:

    {
        "access_token": "the_access_token", 
        "token_type": "Bearer", 
        "expires_in": 86400, 
        "refresh_token": "the_refresh_token", 
        "scope": ""
    }

You may now go ahead and use the API, sending your `access_token` in the 
`Authorization` HTTP header as follows:

    Authorization: Bearer <the_access_token>


Once the `access_token` expires, you may use the `refresh_token` to
request a new one:

    curl https://api.elorus.com/oauth/token/  \
    -X POST \
    -H 'Accept:application/json' \
    -u client_id:client_secret \
    -d '{ \
    "grant_type": "refresh_token", \
    "refresh_token": "the_refresh_token" \
    }'
OAuth2.name: Authorization

scopes.user: Perform any action a specific user can perform

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `first_name`, `last_name`, `company`, `profession`, `vat_number`, `email__email`, `phones__number`, `addresses__address`, `addresses__city`, `addresses__state`.

parameters.name: letter
parameters.description: Optionally filter by starting letter. Refers to the contact's "display_name."

parameters.name: ctype
parameters.description: Optionally filter by contact type. Either `client` or `supplier`.

parameters.name: profession
parameters.description: Optionally filter by profession.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Optionally filter by company.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `display_name`, `profession`, `vat_number`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-display_name`).

post.description:
Create a new contact.
---
This endpoint will add a new contact to the specified organization.
Although `first_name`, `last_name` and `company` are not required
fields, at least one of them must be specified for the record
to be valid. The created contact's ID is included in
the response.

contact_display_format.title: Default display format
contact_display_format.description:
How you want your contacts to appear in the contacts page and in all contact / client / supplier selection boxes across the application. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
f l - cFName LName - Company
l, f - cLname, FName - Company
l f - cLname FName - Company
c - f lCompany - FName LName
c - l, fCompany - LName, FName
c - l fCompany - LName FName

address_format.title: Address format
address_format.description: The format in which your company's and your contacts' addresses will be displayed. Predefined placeholders, space characters and ',', '.', '-', '|' are allowed.

calculator_mode.title: Default value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Set how Elorus calculates values in your Estimates, Invoices, Purchases & Recurring documents. This is a default value that you can override for each document. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

draft_auto_numbering.title: Auto-numbering of draft documents
draft_auto_numbering.description: If enabled, Elorus will always allocate a number when creating a new document. Disable this setting if you want your new documents to receive a number only after they're issued.

strict_sequential_numbering.title: Force sequential numbering
strict_sequential_numbering.description: If enabled, invoices & credit notes will only be issued if they follow a valid sequential numbering.

numbering_padding.title: Numbering padding
numbering_padding.description:
The total number of numerals in the document's number (e.g. "005" or "00005"). One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
33 digits
44 digits
55 digits
66 digits
77 digits
88 digits
99 digits
1010 digits

negative_stock.title: Allow negative stock
negative_stock.description: If you disable this option, Elorus will prevent you from invoicing products that are out of stock. The setting applies only to products / services whose stock is managed.

slack_notifications.title: Slack notifications
slack_notifications.description: Send a slack message whenever a new notification is created.
